intro: Myriactis humilis, commonly known as the lowland myriactis, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous areas with well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
